org.springframework.context.support
Class PropertyResourceConfigurer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.springframework.context.support.ApplicationObjectSupport
        |
        +--org.springframework.context.support.PropertyResourceConfigurer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ApplicationContextAware, BeanFactoryPostProcessor
public class PropertyResourceConfigurer
extends ApplicationObjectSupport
implements BeanFactoryPostProcessor

Allows for configuration of individual bean properties from a property resource, i.e. a properties file. Useful for custom config files targetted at system administrators that override bean properties configured in the application context.

Expects configuration lines of the following form:
beanName.property=value

Since:
12.03.2003
Author:
Juergen Hoeller

setLocation

public void setLocation(java.lang.String location)
Set the location of the properties file. Allows for both a URL and a (file) path, according to the respective ApplicationContext.
See Also:
ApplicationContext.getResourceAsStream(java.lang.String)

postProcessBeanFactory

public void postProcessBeanFactory(ListableBeanFactoryImpl beanFactory)
                            throws ApplicationContextException
Description copied from interface: BeanFactoryPostProcessor
Modify the application context's internal bean factory after its standard initialization. All bean definitions will have been loaded, but no beans will have been instantiated yet. This allows for overriding or adding properties even to eager-initializing beans.
Specified by:
postProcessBeanFactory in interface BeanFactoryPostProcessor
Following copied from interface: org.springframework.context.support.BeanFactoryPostProcessor
Parameters:
beanFactory - the bean factory used by the application context
Throws:
ApplicationContextException - in case of initialization errors
